Comment: The absolute theoretical maximum would be to get 100% of the votes in all the big states and 50% - 1 of the votes in all the small states. I don't have updated numbers, but according to [this CGP Grey video](https://youtu.be/7wC42HgLA4k?feature=shared&t=259) it was 78% in 2012. Of course, this is an extreme edge case that would never happen in practice.  Edit: Actually, the *absolute* minimum would be if there were three or more candidates, one of them won 50% + 1 in Wyoming, no one else won a majority, and the person who won Wyoming was voted president in the House.
